particles
Class Particle

java.lang.Object
  particles.Particle

public class Particle
extends java.lang.Object

A simple particle with an x,y position and square shape.

Base on the Particle class provided by Lea

Constructor Detail

Particle

public Particle(int initialX,
                int initialY)
Creates a Particle with the specified position.

Parameters:
initialX - Starting horizontal position
initialY - Starting vertical position
Method Detail

move

public void move()
Moves the Particle randomly.

Favors vertical motion, and is more likely to move up and to the left. (Lea appears to call Random.nextInt(n) under the assumption that the range returned is [0,n] when it is actually [0,n)

inBounds

public java.lang.Boolean inBounds(int width,
                                  int height)
Checks if the Particle is in the bounding rectangle.

Assumes the top left corner is at 0, 0 and the bottom right is at width, height.

Parameters:
width - Width of bounding rectangle
height - Height of bounding rectangle
Returns:
True if the particle is partially contained within the rectangle

nearPoint

public java.lang.Boolean nearPoint(int x,
                                   int y,
                                   int r)
Checks if the Particle is near the specified point.

Parameters:
x - Horizontal position of the point
y - Vertical position of the point
r - Radius of the bounding circle
Returns:
True if the particle is within radius of point (x,y)

nearPoint

public java.lang.Boolean nearPoint(int x,
                                   int y)
Checks if the Particle is near the specified point.

Calls nearPoint(x, y, r) with r = the side length of the particle.

Parameters:
x - Horizontal position of the point
y - Vertical position of the point
Returns:
True if the particle is near point (x,y)

draw

public void draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
Draws the particle at its current position.

Parameters:
g - Graphics device to use for output
